demographics.diagnosis: Post-amputation (bilateral risk), extensive leg wound (350 sq cm)
demographics.region: Pennsylvania (Erie region mentioned for provider backup)

case_header.outcome: Successful Home Discharge with Integrated HHA/Wound Care

clinical_logic.readiness_milestone: PT goals met and wounds sufficiently healing for home management
clinical_barriers: High risk of infection (prior amputation on contralateral limb)
Massive wound size (350 sq cm) requiring specialized dressing
Need for immediate post-discharge wound care continuity

environmental_logic.physical_barriers: Inaccessible home entry (need for wheelchair ramp)
bureaucratic_steps: Procurement of three separate contractor estimates
Selection and approval of the specific contractor

timeline_deltas.context: The waiver process required three separate estimates and a multi-step approval chain, stretching a 2-week estimate to 1.5 months.
Assigned wound care provider contracted COVID; required coordinating a replacement provider from the Erie region to visit the following Monday.

reasoning_trace_triples.situation: Initial patient resistance/skepticism regarding PN services.
reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Direct in-person meeting and alignment with patient's self-reported progress.
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Patient accepted services; PN became the primary info conduit.

reasoning_trace_triples.situation: Social Worker lacked real-time updates on ramp progress.
reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Daily check-ins with the patient (who was talking to the CHC coordinator).
reasoning_trace_triples.result: PN bypassed the SNF information lag to provide accurate forecasts to the home team.

reasoning_trace_triples.situation: Specialist provider illness left a 72-hour care gap post-discharge.
reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Coordinated with HHA (OSTPA) to perform dressing changes on Friday and Sunday.
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Wound integrity maintained until replacement specialist arrived Monday.

rank_1_best_practices.context: Provider availability crisis due to illness.
rank_1_best_practices.action: Leveraged existing HHA relationship to cover the gap and outsourced a provider from another region.
rank_1_best_practices.rationale: Prioritizes clinical safety over standard scheduling protocols.

rank_1_best_practices.action: Recognized the patient as the most reliable source for CHC waiver updates compared to the SW.
rank_1_best_practices.rationale: Utilizes the most direct data source to manage stakeholder expectations.

rank_0_boundary_failures.action: Failed to present a cost-benefit analysis of private pay vs. waiver delay.
Assumed home accessibility was verified by SNF/PT.

unscripted_chaos_signals: Provider COVID-19 infection at the moment of discharge
Regional shortage of advanced wound care specialists
Patient miscalculation of discharge timeline (initially thinking it was 2 days away)
